p: Flaviviridae family contains clinically important arboviruses with four genera including Hepacivirus (one species that is hepatitis C virus), Pestivirus (four species), Pegivirus (two species) and Flavivirus (53 species). Other than hepatitis C virus, most of the clinically relevant pathogens belong to the genus Flavivirus [ 28]. The most significant clinical manifestations by Flaviviruses include fever, rashes, encephalitis, visceral involvement and hemorrhagic fever [ 29].
